ARABIC: يَتَنَٰزَعُونَ فِيهَا كَأْسًا لَّا لَغْوٌ فِيهَا وَلَا تَأْثِيمٌ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: They will pass round there a drinking cup to one another with no foolish talk and no wrong action in it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: They will exchange cups of wine free of (incitement to) pleasantry or sin.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: They shall pass on to one another a cup that will incite neither levity nor sin.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They will pass cups of un-intoxicating and unsinful wine to one another.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: In it, they accept cups from each other, in which is neither any lewdness nor any sin.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: There they shall pass from hand to hand a cup, free from any idle talk, and free from sin.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: They shall pass therein from one to another a cup wherein there shall be nothing vain nor any sin.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: while they pass therein a cup one to another wherein is no idle talk, no cause of sin,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: There they pass from hand to hand a cup wherein is neither vanity nor cause of sin.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: There, they shall pass from hand to hand a cup which does not lead to any idle talk or sin.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: They will therein snatch from one another a cup; therein will be neither vain babble nor sin.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: There they will pass from hand to hand a cup wherein there will be neither any vain talk nor sinful speech.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: They shall there exchange, one with another, a (loving) cup free of frivolity, free of all taint of ill.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: There they shall pass from hand to hand a (wine) cup, free from any Laghw (dirty, false, evil vague talk between them), and free from sin (because it will be legal for them to drink).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: There they will pass a goblet to one another with neither idle talk nor sin,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: They will exchange therein a cup; wherein is neither harm, nor sin.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: They will exchange with one another a cup [of wine] wherein [results] no ill speech or commission of sin.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [52:23] They will pass from one to another therein, in Paradise, a cup, [of] wine, wherein is neither vain talk, which might come about between them as a result of drinking it, nor cause for sin, thereby, that might befall them — in contrast to [the case with] the wine of this world.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: There) in the Garden (they pass from hand to hand a cup) of wine (wherein is neither vanity) stomach-ache because of drinking it (nor cause of sin) from drinking it; it is also said that "vanity" means: falsehood and oaths, and "cause of sin" means: abusing and lying to each other, which means: in the Garden there is neither falsehood and oaths nor abuse and lying. 617
